intro: Phagnalon stenolepis subsp. abdulazizianum, commonly known as the Persian phagnalon, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the Middle East. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers. This subspecies is noted for its ecological significance in stabilizing soil in harsh environments.
